snippet: Money managers in Europe’s financial hub say they still expect Washington to reach a debt deal — in part because the alternative is too dire to contemplate.
abstract: Money managers in City of London, Europe’s financial hub, say they still expect Washington to reach a debt deal, in part because the alternative is too dire to contemplate; they are watching Congress's wranglings with incredulity.
lead_paragraph: Money managers in Europe’s financial hub say they still expect Washington to reach a debt deal — in part because the alternative is too dire to contemplate.
